section.title: Evacuate instances
section.para: If a cloud compute node fails due to a hardware malfunction or another reason, you can evacuate instances to make them available again.
You can choose evacuation parameters for your use case.
To preserve user data on server disk, you must configure shared storage on the target host. Also, you must validate that the current VM host is down. Otherwise the evacuation fails with an error.

To preserve the user disk data on the evacuated server, deploy OpenStack Compute with shared file system. To configure your system, see Configure migrations in OpenStack Configuration Reference. In this example, the password remains unchanged.
